greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The lower left triangle of the ED2 array A167560.
comment: We discovered that the numbers that appear in the lower left triangle of the ED2 array A167560 (m <= n) behave in a regular way, see the formula below. This rather simple regularity doesn't show up in the upper right triangle of the ED2 array (m > n).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for the first 50 rows
example: The first few triangle rows are:
maple: a := proc(n, m): 4^(m-1)*(m-1)!*(n+m-1)!/(2*m-1)! end: seq(seq(a(n, m), m=1..n), n=1..8); # _Johannes W. Meijer_, revised Nov 23 2012
xref: A047053, 2*A034177 and A167570 are the first three right hand triangle columns.
A000142, 4*A001715, 32*A001725, 384* A049388 and 6144* A049398 are the first five left hand triangle columns.
results.author: _Johannes W. Meijer_, Nov 10 2009
